metadata.title: CVE-2017-8934 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
PCManFM 1.2.5 insecurely uses /tmp for a socket file, allowing a local userto cause a denial of service (application unavailability).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-8934` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

pcmanfm - 1.2.4-1ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: pcmanfm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.2.4-1ubuntu0.1').
